name: Nuanced
headline: Nuanced makes AI coding tools smarter with static analysis.
description: We're building tools that combine static analysis with AI to obtain a deeper understanding of code behavior. By doing so, we help both humans and machines understand code behavior at a fundamental level.

founders.name: Ayman Nadeem, Founder
founders.description:
Founder and CEO of Nuanced. Formerly at GitHub for 7+ years. 

MSc in CS from University of Oxford + engineering valedictorian from University of Waterloo. 

https://www.aymannadeem.com/about/

raw_markdown="[Nuanced](https://www.nuanced.dev/</>)
[Blog](https://www.nuanced.dev/</blog>)
# Make AI tools smarterwith semantic understanding
Nuanced combines static analysis with AI to give coding tools deeper understanding of code behavior.
[Get Early Access](https://www.nuanced.dev/<https:/forms.gle/GjaNDKwAeuBD9aeu5>)
## Built by developers who've been there
We're ex-GitHub engineers and researchers who've scaled some of the world's largest developer platforms. We've seen AI's potential—and its pitfalls. We're dedicated to advancing AI coding tools by addressing their limitations, and ensuring they truly empower developers.
## For tool builders
Whether you're building the next IDE or AI assistant, our semantic understanding layer helps your tools make better decisions.
## Latest Posts
[February 3, 2025Memory profilers, call graphs, exception reports, and telemetry: here’s what happened when we gave AI coding tools system-wide context](https://www.nuanced.dev/</blog/system-wide-context>)[January 23, 2025Beyond file trees: why AI coding assistants need smarter context](https://www.nuanced.dev/</blog/beyond-file-trees>)[January 2, 2025The reliability gap: as AI writes more code, we need better tools to trust it](https://www.nuanced.dev/</blog/the-reliability-gap>)

generated_description:
**Company Overview: Nuanced**

Founded in 2023 and based in San Francisco, Nuanced is an emerging player in the world of AI-driven development tools. With a sharp focus on static analysis, Nuanced aims to enhance AI coding tools by giving them a deeper understanding of code behavior. Their mission is straightforward yet ambitious: to make AI tools smarter, enabling both developers and machines to better grasp what the code is really doing.

**The Team and Support**

Nuanced is a small but experienced team, comprising just two dedicated employees, including ex-GitHub engineers who have worked on some of the largest developer platforms out there. Their background gives them unique insights into the potential and challenges of AI in coding. They are currently part of Y Combinator's Batch W24, a robust accelerator that provides both mentorship and resources for high-growth startups.

**What They Offer**

At its core, Nuanced combines static analysis with AI to create a semantic understanding layer that promises to enhance decision-making for tool builders, whether they're developing an integrated development environment (IDE) or a new AI assistant. This approach aims to address limitations faced by existing AI coding tools, making them not just more intelligent but also truly empowering for developers.

**Current Initiatives and Thoughts**

Nuanced is actively engaged in both research and practical applications. They're sharing insights through a blog that touches on relevant topics for today’s coding landscape, including system-wide context for AI tools and the reliability of AI-generated code. Their latest posts explore significant themes in the AI coding space, inviting readers to consider how to better trust and leverage AI in their work.

**Get Involved**

For those intrigued by their promise of smarter coding tools, Nuanced is offering early access sign-ups on their website. You can check them out at [Nuanced](https://www.nuanced.dev/) to learn more and stay tuned as they develop their innovative approach to AI in tech.

Ultimately, Nuanced isn’t just building another AI tool; it's redefining how we understand and interact with code through a fresh lens of semantic analysis, making them one to watch in the ever-evolving realm of developer tools.
